item.title: I-70 East - Exit 116
item.description: I-70 east approaching Exit 116 - CO-82 East/Glenwood Springs/Aspen.

item.title: End CO-82 East at US-24
item.description: End CO-82 East at US-24. Use US-24 west to Leadville; US-24 east to Buena Vista.

item.title: CO-82 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on CO-82 east. Distance to Leadville (via US-24 west) and Buena Vista (via US-24 east).

item.title: CO-82 East - Independence Pass
item.description: Independence Pass on CO-82 east. Independence Pass is 12,095 Feet and on the Continental Divide. Independence Pass is one of the highest mountain passes in Colorado on the state highway system. The only higher pass on the state highway system is US-34 in Rocky Mountain National Park. Independence Pass divides the Arkansas River watershed which flows into the Gulf of Mexico; and the Roaring Fork River which flows into the Colorado River and the Gulf of California.

item.title: CO-82 East - Aspen
item.description: CO-82 east (Original St.) at East Cooper Ave. in Aspen. Turn left on Cooper Ave. to continue east on CO-82 and for the Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway.

item.title: CO-82 East - Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway
item.description: Begin Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway on CO-82 East.

item.title: CO-82 East - Entering Aspen
item.description: Entering Aspen - Elevation 7908 Feet. Aspen is the county seat of Pitkin County.

item.title: CO-82 East - Snowmass Village Jct.
item.description: CO-82 east at Brush Creek Road south to Snowmass Village. Continue east on CO-82 for Aspen.

item.title: CO-82 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on CO-82 east. Distance to Snowmass Village Road and Aspen.

item.title: CO-82 East - Snowmass Creek Road Jct.
item.description: CO-82 east at Snowmass Creek Road. Continue east on CO-82 for Snowmass Village and Ski Areas.

item.title: CO-82 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on CO-82 east. Distance to Snowmass, and Snowmass Village Road.

item.title: CO-82 East - Pitkin County
item.description: Entering Pitkin County on CO-82 east.

item.title: CO-82 East - Basalt
item.description: Entering Basalt on CO-82 east. Basalt is a town in the Roaring Fork Valley, located where the Frying Pan River meets the Roaring Fork.

item.title: CO-82 East at CO-133 South
item.description: CO-82 East at CO-133 South in Carbondale.

item.title: CO-82 East Approaching CO-133 South
item.description: CO-82 East approaching CO-133 South to Redstone and Carbondale. Continue east on CO-82 for Aspen.

item.title: CO-82 East - McClure Pass Status
item.description: CO-82 East - CO-133/McClure Pass Status. McClure Pass is located on CO-133 between Redstone and Paonia.

item.title: CO-82 East - Independence Pass Status
item.description: Independence Pass Status on CO-82 east leaving Glenwood Springs. Typically Independence Pass, just east of Aspen closes between November and May. Independence Pass is one of the highest highway passes in Colorado.

item.title: CO-82 East - Grand Ave. Junction
item.description: CO-82 east at Grand Ave. Junction in Glenwood Springs. Merge right to continue south on Grand Ave.

item.title: I-70 East (Exit 116 Offramp) at CO-82
item.description: I-70 East (Exit 116 Offramp) at CO-82 in Glenwood Springs. Turn left for CO-82 east to Glenwood Springs and Aspen.

item.title: I-70 East - Exit 116
item.description: I-70 east approaching Exit 116 - CO-82 East/Glenwood Springs/Aspen.

item.title: I-70 West Exit 116
item.description: I-70 West at CO-82 East Junction
